pdf.intro: This material contains activities organized by level: beginner, intermediate and advanced. They can be played at home or in the classroom, using simple resources.

sections.beginner_content: Activities focused on literacy and first contact with words and images.

beginner_games.title: Memory Game – Image and Word
beginner_games.summary: Match images with their corresponding words.
instructions: Print cards with images and the corresponding words.
Shuffle the cards and place them face down on a table.
Players take turns flipping two cards to find a matching pair.
The player with the most pairs at the end wins.

beginner_games.title: Alphabet Bingo
beginner_games.summary: Recognize letters of the alphabet through play.
instructions: Prepare bingo cards with letters of the alphabet.
The teacher or parent draws letters from a bag and announces them.
Players mark the corresponding letter on their card.
The first to complete a line or the entire card wins.

beginner_games.title: Object Hunt
beginner_games.summary: Identify objects based on written or spoken clues.
instructions: Write down simple names of objects (e.g., ball, chair, spoon).
Call out the word or show the written card.
Children must find the object in the room.
The first to bring the correct object earns a point.

sections.intermediate_content: Activities for vocabulary building and forming simple sentences.

intermediate_games.title: Word Domino
instructions: Create domino tiles where one side has a syllable and the other completes a word.
Distribute tiles among players.
Players take turns placing tiles so the syllables form correct words.
The first to use all their tiles wins.

intermediate_games.title: Hangman (adapted)
intermediate_games.summary: Guess the secret word by suggesting letters.
instructions: Choose a simple word and draw blank spaces on paper.
Players suggest letters one at a time.
For each incorrect guess, draw part of a figure (e.g., a stick figure).
The goal is to guess the word before the drawing is complete.

intermediate_games.title: Sentence Building
intermediate_games.summary: Form simple sentences from word cards.
instructions: Prepare cards with nouns, verbs, and adjectives.
Distribute the cards among players.
Players take turns forming short sentences using at least 3 cards.
The group votes on the funniest or most creative sentence.

sections.advanced_content: Activities for text comprehension, logical reasoning and storytelling.

advanced_games.title: Story Continuation
advanced_games.summary: Create a collaborative story by taking turns adding sentences.
instructions: The first player starts a story with one sentence (e.g., 'Once upon a time there was a child who loved adventures').
Each player continues the story with a new sentence.
The story continues until everyone agrees on an ending.
At the end, read the full story aloud.

advanced_games.title: Word Search
advanced_games.summary: Find words hidden in a grid of letters.
instructions: Prepare a word search puzzle with words related to a specific theme (e.g., animals, fruits, school).
Distribute the grids to players.
Players must find and circle all the listed words hidden in the grid.
The first to find all words wins.

advanced_games.title: Debate Challenge
advanced_games.summary: Practice argumentation and reasoning through debates.
instructions: Divide players into two groups.
Choose a simple theme (e.g., 'Books are better than TV').
Each group prepares 2–3 arguments.
Groups take turns presenting arguments, and the audience decides the winner.
